column1: #Text=Mauritanian refugees begin returning home from Senegal
#Text=refugees stuck in Senegal for nearly two decades after fleeing ethnic clashes in their home country have begun returning to Mauritania under a U.N. -sponsored program .
#Text=But many do not want to return .
#Text=There were goodbye ceremonies and welcoming ceremonies attended by officials on both sides of the Senegal River as more than 100 former refugees were ferried on motorized pirogues .
#Text=A spokesman for the United Nations refugee agency , Alphonse Munyaneza , explained international funding will help pay for resettlement .
#Text=" Each refugee returning back to Mauritania will receive a piece of land equivalent to 140 square meters for establishing a house .
